Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables

Jump to Recipe

Are you looking for a nutritious and vibrant dish that’s perfect for any occasion? Look no further than this Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables! Packed with protein-rich quinoa and a colorful array of roasted veggies, this salad not only tantalizes your taste buds but also fuels your body with essential nutrients. The combination of sweet bell peppers, tender zucchini, and zesty red onion creates a delightful medley of flavors that are enhanced by the freshness of parsley and a splash of lemon juice. Whether you're preparing a light lunch, a side dish for dinner, or a potluck favorite, this quinoa salad is incredibly versatile and easy to make. Plus, it’s gluten-free and can be made vegan if you skip the optional feta cheese. Join me as we explore this simple yet satisfying recipe that will elevate your healthy eating game!

Ingredients

quinoa

Rinse quinoa thoroughly before cooking to remove saponins, which can give a bitter taste. For added flavor, you can toast the quinoa in a dry pan for a few minutes before boiling it. If you don't have quinoa, consider using couscous, bulgur, or even rice as a substitute.

bell peppers (mixed colors)

Choose bell peppers that are firm and vibrant in color for the best flavor. Roasting enhances their sweetness; you can also marinate them in balsamic vinegar for an extra flavor boost. If you're out of bell peppers, try using other vegetables such as cherry tomatoes or carrots.

zucchini

Select young, firm zucchinis for a better texture. When slicing, consider cutting them into half-moons or cubes for even cooking. If zucchini is not available, yellow squash can be a good substitute.

red onion

Red onions are milder and sweeter than yellow onions, making them perfect for salads. Soaking them in cold water for 10-15 minutes can reduce their sharpness if desired. If you don't have red onions, yellow or sweet onions can be used instead.

olive oil

Use high-quality extra virgin olive oil for the best flavor. You can infuse it with garlic or herbs for an extra layer of taste. If you're looking for a substitute, avocado oil or melted coconut oil can work, though they will change the flavor profile slightly.

salt

Use sea salt or kosher salt for better flavor control. Remember, you can always add more salt later, but you can't take it out once it's in. If you're watching your sodium intake, try using herbs and spices to enhance flavor instead.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper adds a stronger flavor than pre-ground pepper. Experiment with different types of peppercorns for varied flavors, such as white or pink peppercorns. If you're out of black pepper, a pinch of cayenne or chili powder can provide some heat.

lemon juice

Freshly squeezed lemon juice is preferable to bottled for a brighter flavor. You can also add lemon zest for an extra citrusy kick. If you don't have lemons, lime juice or vinegar can serve as good substitutes.

feta cheese (optional)

Feta adds a tangy and creamy element to the salad. If you want a dairy-free option, try using crumbled tofu or nutritional yeast for a cheesy flavor. Other alternatives include goat cheese or even a sprinkle of parmesan.

fresh parsley

Use flat-leaf parsley for a more robust flavor compared to curly parsley. Chop it finely to release its oils. If you don't have parsley, fresh basil or cilantro can offer a different but delightful flavor profile.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Start by preheating your oven to 400°F (200°C). This ensures that the vegetables roast evenly and develop a nice caramelization.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Quinoa

    Rinse 1 cup of quinoa under cold water in a fine mesh strainer to remove any bitterness. Then, cook it according to the package instructions, generally using 2 cups of water for every cup of quinoa. Bring the water to a boil, add the quinoa, reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook for about 15 minutes.

  • Step 3: Chop the Vegetables

    While the quinoa is cooking, chop 2 mixed-color bell peppers, 1 zucchini, and 1 red onion into bite-sized pieces. This not only makes them easier to eat but also helps them roast evenly.

  • Step 4: Toss with Olive Oil and Seasonings

    Place the chopped vegetables on a baking sheet. Drizzle 3 tablespoons of olive oil over them, then season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss everything together until the vegetables are evenly coated.

  • Step 5: Roast the Vegetables

    Spread the seasoned vegetables out evenly on the baking sheet. Roast them in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until they are tender and slightly caramelized. Stir halfway through to ensure even roasting.

  • Step 6: Combine Ingredients

    In a large bowl, combine the cooked quinoa with the roasted vegetables. Add 2 tablespoons of lemon juice and 1/4 cup of chopped fresh parsley. Mix everything well to combine the flavors.

  • Step 7: Add Optional Feta Cheese

    If you like, you can sprinkle 1/2 cup of crumbled feta cheese on top of the salad for added flavor and creaminess. This is optional but highly recommended!

  • Step 8: Serve and Enjoy

    Your quinoa salad with roasted vegetables is ready to be served! This salad can be enjoyed warm or cold and makes for a perfect side dish or a light meal.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I rinse quinoa properly?

To rinse quinoa, place it in a fine mesh strainer and run cold water over it for about 30 seconds while using your hand to stir. This helps remove the bitter saponins that coat the seeds.

What is the right water-to-quinoa ratio for cooking?

Typically, the ratio is 2 cups of water for every 1 cup of quinoa. However, always check the package instructions as some brands may vary.

How do I know when the vegetables are done roasting?

The vegetables are done when they are tender and have a nice golden brown color. You can test by piercing them with a fork; they should be soft but not mushy.

Is it necessary to peel the zucchini and red onion?

No, it's not necessary to peel zucchini. The skin is nutritious and adds texture. For the red onion, you can peel it to reduce the sharpness, but it's a matter of personal preference.

How can I prevent my quinoa from being mushy?

Make sure to rinse your quinoa before cooking, and use the correct water-to-quinoa ratio. After cooking, fluff it gently with a fork to separate the grains.

What can I substitute for feta cheese?

If you want to keep it dairy-free, you can leave out the feta cheese or use a plant-based cheese alternative. You could also use avocado for creaminess.

How do I store leftover quinoa salad?

Store leftover quinoa salad in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. The flavors will continue to meld and improve!

Can I add other vegetables to this salad?

Absolutely! Feel free to add other vegetables like carrots, broccoli, or asparagus. Just ensure they roast well and fit into the cooking time.

What type of parsley should I use?

You can use either flat-leaf (Italian) or curly parsley. Flat-leaf has a stronger flavor, while curly parsley is often used as a garnish.

What kitchen tools do I need for this recipe?

You will need a fine mesh strainer, a baking sheet, a chopping board, a knife, a large bowl for mixing, and measuring cups and spoons.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This Quinoa Salad is naturally gluten-free and can be made vegan by omitting the feta cheese. For a more protein-packed option, consider adding chickpeas or black beans. If you're looking for a nut-free alternative, ensure that the olive oil used is from a nut-free facility. This dish is perfect for vegetarian and vegan diets, making it a versatile choice for gatherings.

Pairings

For a delightful meal, serve the Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables alongside grilled chicken or salmon, which will complement the salad's flavors while adding protein. A light white wine, such as Sauvignon Blanc or a crisp Pinot Grigio, pairs beautifully with the citrus notes from the lemon juice. For a non-alcoholic option, consider a refreshing cucumber mint lemonade or sparkling water with a splash of lemon.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Quinoa Salad chilled or at room temperature for the best flavor. Consider using a large, shallow serving bowl to showcase the vibrant colors of the roasted vegetables. Garnish with additional fresh parsley or lemon wedges for an extra pop of color and freshness. This salad can also be served in individual jars or bowls for a picnic or potluck, making it easy for guests to serve themselves.

Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables

45 min
$10
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

Dairy (if using feta)

Course:

Tags:

SaladHealthyQuickVegetarian

Description

A protein-packed salad with vibrant roasted vegetables and a zesty dressing, perfect for a healthy meal.

Ingredients

  • quinoa: 1 cup
  • bell peppers (mixed colors): 2
  • zucchini: 1
  • red onion: 1
  • olive oil: 3 tablespoons
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • lemon juice: 2 tablespoons
  • feta cheese (optional): 1/2 cup
  • fresh parsley: 1/4 cup
